intro: Prospero autumnale subsp. fallax, commonly known as the autumn prospero, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue and a distinctive, fragrant, yellowish flower cluster. The plant blooms in late summer to early autumn, producing small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a suitable addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
